intro: Corymborkis brevistylis, commonly known as the narrow-styled corymborkis, is a flowering plant native to the eastern regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often with a slightly hairy texture. Corymborkis brevistylis is typically found in heathlands and open forests, thriving in well-drained soils.
